qas.question: Which province in Pakistan borders the other 3 provinces?
How many rivers are in Punjab, Pakistan?
What is the easternmost river in Punjab?
How much of Pakistan's population lives in Punjab?
What is Faisalabad the capital of?
How many rivers are in Multan?
What percentage of the Pakistan population resides in Sargodha?
What does the P in the acronym Punjab represent?
What does the S in Pakistan stand for?

context: The capital and largest city is Lahore which was the historical capital of <b5_0>the wider Punjab region<b5_0/>. Other important cities include Faisalabad, Rawalpindi, Gujranwala, Sargodha, Multan, Sialkot, Bahawalpur, Gujrat, Sheikhupura, Jhelum and <b9_0>Sahiwal<b9_0/>. Undivided Punjab is home to <b6_0>six<b6_0/> rivers, of which <a2_0>five<a2_0/> flow through Pakistani Punjab. From west to east, these are: the Indus, Jhelum, Beas, Chenab, Ravi and <a3_0>Sutlej<a3_0/>. <a4_0><b7_0>Nearly 60%<b7_0/><a4_0/> of <b8_0>Pakistan<b8_0/>'s population lives in the <a0_0>Punjab<a0_0/>. It is the nation's only province that touches every other province; it also surrounds the federal enclave of the national capital city at <a1_0>Islamabad<a1_0/>. In the acronym P-A-K-I-S-T-A-N, the P is for Punjab.
